data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Launch descriptions for system modes (#80)

* Initial package for system modes specific launch, launch_system_modes. Launch actions, events, and event handlers allow to
  * change system mode of a node
  * change state and system mode of a system
  * event handler for performed mode changes of nodes
  * event handler for performed state changes and mode changes of systems

* Adds example launch files that change modes
* Adds launch event handler for mode changes
* Mode changes can now be handled in the same way launch_ros state transitions are handled. The example launch file shows how a mode change is triggered after a certain mode has changed
* Documentation of launch_system_modes
* Launch tests for launch_system_modes

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/79

Signed-off-by: Nordmann Arne (CR/ADT3) <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Modes observer (#68)

* Initial mode observer class
* Mutex modes cache for concurrent read/write
* Check for service availability- for the initial service calls, check for service availability first, timeout 500ms.
* Minimal unit tests and launch test for modes observer
* Documentation of mode observer

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/66

Signed-off-by: Nordmann Arne (CR/ADT3) <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Mode manager prevents redundant mode changes (#67)

Before executing a requested mode change, i.e. applying the according
changes, it is now checking whether the mode is already active. If so,
no action is taken, but mode change service request is still returned with
success.

* Mode manager prevents redundant mode changes
* Testing redundant mode change

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/60

Signed-off-by: Nordmann Arne (CR/ADT3) <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Merge latest dev to master (#55)

Version 0.4.2

* Mode inference now capable of detecting deviation between intended and
targeted system state/mode (needs minor fixes)
* Mode manager checking for system deviation after each change
(transition, mode change, parameter change)
* Mode handling successfully parses rules from SMH file
* Documentation of rules and rules example

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/13

data.author: Nordmann Arne (CR/ADT3)
data.message:
Rules feature no longer experimental

* Rules feature has been evaluated and demonstrated in the MROS project
on a mobile robot
* Therefore dropping the 'experimental' annotation

Signed-off-by: Nordmann Arne (CR/ADT3) <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
dev -> master (#52)

* Introduce state/mode deviation
  * Mode inference now capable of detecting deviation between intended and targeted system state/mode (needs minor fixes)
  * Mode manager checking for system deviation after each change (transition, mode change, parameter change)
* Comparison operator for StateAndMode
* Prototypical error handling and rules
  * Prototypical rules in example modes file
  * Adds ModeHandling classfor rules parsing
  * In case of deviations, mode manager finds the correct rules
  * First exemplary set of mode rules working
* Documentation of rules and the rules example
* Version bump to 0.4.1

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/13

Signed-off-by: Arne Nordmann <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Merge latest dev into master (#49)

Mode manager is now publishing transitions that are inferred by the mode
inference, i.e. state and mode transitions of systems, mode transitions
of nodes.

* Stricter constness in mode inference
* ModeEvent now includes start mode (of transition)
* Adds inference of transitions to mode inference
* Tests for transition inference
* Mode manager publishs inferred transitions
* Version push to 0.4.0

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/42

Signed-off-by: Arne Nordmann <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Replace API deprecated in Foxy (#21)

Since the deprecated API was removed in Rolling, this change should fix the failure here: http://build.ros2.org/view/Rbin_uF64/job/Rbin_uF64__system_modes_examples__ubuntu_focal_amd64__binary/12/

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Dev (#20)

* Refactors state and mode pair to struct (#16)
* Adds 'how to apply' section to doc (#18): Documents how to design (and how not to design) system modes
* Tests for mode inference
* Use ament_target_dependencies to link boost_program_options (#17)

find_package(Boost) may pass file paths for Boost libraries which are
not in the default search locations at link time.

Since FindBoost.cmake sets Boost_<C>_FOUND and Boost_<C>_LIBRARIES for
each requested component, we can let ament_target_dependencies discover
the component as if it were a standalone package.

Signed-off-by: Arne Nordmann <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

Co-authored-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>
Co-authored-by: Ralph Lange <ralph-lange@users.noreply.github.com>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Use ament_target_dependencies to link boost_program_options (#17)

find_package(Boost) may pass file paths for Boost libraries which are
not in the default search locations at link time.

Since FindBoost.cmake sets Boost_<C>_FOUND and Boost_<C>_LIBRARIES for
each requested component, we can let ament_target_dependencies discover
the component as if it were a standalone package.

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Use ament_target_dependencies to link boost_program_options (#17)

find_package(Boost) may pass file paths for Boost libraries which are
not in the default search locations at link time.

Since FindBoost.cmake sets Boost_<C>_FOUND and Boost_<C>_LIBRARIES for
each requested component, we can let ament_target_dependencies discover
the component as if it were a standalone package.

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Feature/launch file example (#12)

* Very simple example of a launch file for the mode-manager.
* Replaced dash by underscore in node executables.
* Add ROS parameter to pass path to model file.
* Created generic launch files for mode_manager and mode_monitor.
* Changed sample launch file to use new mode_manager launch file.

Signed-off-by: Ralph Lange <ralph.lange@de.bosch.com>

* Updated description of extended lifecycle
* Integrated with ROS 2 launch
* mode-monitor and mode-manager can now be started with ros2 launch by
passing the model file as launch argument
* system modes example nodes are now started with ros2 launch as well
* Launch descriptor for system + mode manager
* Cleanup, uncrustify

https://github.com/micro-ROS/system_modes/issues/11

Signed-off-by: Arne Nordmann <arne.nordmann@de.bosch.com>

Co-authored-by: Ralph Lange <ralph.lange@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Arne Nordmann
data.message:
Migrated to ROS 2 Crystal

* Adapted to new (Change/Get)State service messages
  * node name has to be inferred from the topic now, no longer part of the message
* Adapted system modes example to new lifecycle API
  * adapted lifycycle hooks
  * changed service calls in README instructions according to new state service messages
